name: Get Me Outa Here!
description:
I love spelunking, but I'm terrified of cave-ins. I need you to make me a function that will show me the quickest path to the exit.

Given a map where a full stop represents a walkable path, a tilde (~) represents a tricky, but walkable path which takes twice as long to navigate, W represents the cave wall, O represents the starting position and X represents the cave exit, as below, return a list of directions to help me escape the cave as quickly as possible. 

WWWWWWW
W..~~.W
W.WWW.W
W..XWOW
WWWWWWW

The map will be sent to the function as seen below.

escape('WWWWWWW\nW..~~.W\nW.WWW.W\nW..XWOW\nWWWWWWW');

The directions are north, south, east and west and should be comma separated.
eg: "north,north,west,west,west,west,south,south,east,east"

Another example with two possible paths: 

WWWWWWW
W..X~~W
W.WWW~W
W.WWW~W
W.WO~~W
W...WWW
WWWWWWW

The map will be sent to the function as seen below.

escape('WWWWWWW\nW..X\~~W\nW.WWW~W\nW.WWW~W\nW.WO~\~W\nW...WWW\nWWWWWWW');

The quickest path is not the shortest path in this case:
"south,west,west,north,north,north,north,east,east"

There will always be a starting position and an end position. If there is no valid path, return an empty string.

Beware, maps may not always be rectangular!
